body_html:
I've been getting the same set of errors

Using macOSX Sierra, and spyder with a tensorflow environment installed through conda.

Anaconda navigator says that tensorboard is installed in both the base and tensorflow environments, and there are two tensorboard executables: one in /anaconda3/bin and the other in /anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin. Just running either of these files on its own gives two different errors. The base tensorboard file gives:
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'

The tensorflow env version gives:
ValueError: A logdir must be specified when db is not specified. Run tensorboard --help for details and examples.

Trying to run some of the above suggested fixes from the terminal gives the following
python -m tensorflow.tensorboard
/anaconda3/bin/python: Error while finding module specification for 'tensorflow.tensorboard' (ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow')

tensorboard
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'

As a workaround, on my configuration I can run the tensorflow env tensorboard file from the terminal:
/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin/tensorboard --logdir=path

I hope that helps anyone struggling with the same issue. Taking tensorboard out of tensorflow seems to have caused a problem with the conda install (at least if you use multiple environments) that isn't fixed yet.

Using macOSX Sierra, and spyder with a tensorflow environment installed through conda.
Anaconda navigator says that tensorboard is installed in both the base and tensorflow environments, and there are two tensorboard executables: one in /anaconda3/bin and the other in /anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin. Just running either of these files on its own gives two different errors. The base tensorboard file gives:

The tensorflow env version gives:

Trying to run some of the above suggested fixes from the terminal gives the following

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'
As a workaround, on my configuration I can run the tensorflow env tensorboard file from the terminal:
/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin/tensorboard --logdir=path
I hope that helps anyone struggling with the same issue. Taking tensorboard out of tensorflow seems to have caused a problem with the conda install (at least if you use multiple environments) that isn't fixed yet.
body:
I've been getting the same set of errors

Using macOSX Sierra, and spyder with a tensorflow environment installed through conda.

Anaconda navigator says that tensorboard is installed in _both_ the base and tensorflow environments, and there are two tensorboard executables: one in /anaconda3/bin and the other in /anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin. Just running either of these files on its own gives two different errors. The base tensorboard file gives: 
**ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'** 

The tensorflow env version gives:
**ValueError: A logdir must be specified when db is not specified. Run `tensorboard --help` for details and examples.**

Trying to run some of the above suggested fixes from the terminal gives the following
python -m tensorflow.tensorboard
**/anaconda3/bin/python: Error while finding module specification for 'tensorflow.tensorboard' (ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow')**

tensorboard
**ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow'**

As a workaround, on my configuration I can run the tensorflow env tensorboard file from the terminal:
/anaconda3/envs/tensorflow/bin/tensorboard --logdir=path

I hope that helps anyone struggling with the same issue. Taking tensorboard out of tensorflow seems to have caused a problem with the conda install (at least if you use multiple environments) that isn't fixed yet.
